subject: Re: [junit] Problems with assertEquals()
msgSnippet: Hi, ... Can you post the code of your equals() method? Or step through the code in a debugger? My guess is that you did not write bool assertEquals(Object
messageBody:
Hi,

> But if I wanna test directly with "assertEquals()" it breaks:
>
> ----- snip -----
> assertEquals("My Test", object1, object2);
> ----- snap -----

Can you post the code of your equals() method?
Or step through the code in a debugger?

My guess is that you did not write
bool assertEquals(Object other)
but
bool assertEquals(MyClass other)
Then in assertTrue(object1.equals(object2)) your method is called.
To fit the assertEquals argument list, the arguments get converted to
Object, and the original Object.equals(Object) is called.

Robert
